Key Match Events: Sean Williams scored a fine half ton and got the equation down to 26 needed in the last two.
Hossain got two wickets in two balls to seal the deal but the last one was deemed as a no ball.
It came down to 4 needed on the last ball but it was Hossain who kept his cool to come out on top.
Third Umpire gives NO BALL! Players are now returning back to the field.
Mosaddek is with the ball, Zimbabwe need 4 off 1. Will they? Will they?
No! Muzarabani misses it. Frustration on the face completely but now Bangladesh can celebrate.
Finally, Bangladesh win by three runs
Post-Match Reflections: Credit to Zimbabwe to show the fight they did but it was Bangladesh who held their nerve and have bagged vital two points after three-run win over Zimbabwe at the Gabba.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The last couple of overs had more twists than a spiral!
What a game that turned out to be! Never really thought it would get that close.
The drama does not end here.
The stumps have to be put back again and the players are recalled.
